meanings.definition: relating to the study or treatment of blood
meanings.sent1: The hematological test showed the levels of blood cells in the body.
meanings.sent2: Doctors use hematological techniques to diagnose blood disorders.
meanings.sent3: The hematological research lab was filled with vials of blood samples.
meanings.sent4: Her dedication to hematological studies was as deep as the color of blood itself.
meanings.sent5: The hematological textbook explained the functions of different blood components clearly.

meanings.definition: pertaining to the branch of medicine that deals with blood and blood-forming organs
meanings.sent1: The hematological specialist focused on treating blood-related diseases.
meanings.sent2: Hematological experts work in hospitals to care for patients with blood disorders.
meanings.sent3: The hematological conference brought together doctors from various specialties.
meanings.sent4: His knowledge of hematological conditions was as vast as the circulatory system.
meanings.sent5: The hematological department at the hospital was always busy with blood tests and transfusions.
